SRP: Selectively Regularized Pruning

File: tasks/srp_translation.py

  • Contain source code for adding tasks of srp translation to fairseq tasks.

tasks.srp_translation. SRPTranslationConfig (FairseqDataclass ) 

Data configuration for translation tasks.

Configurations:

  • data (str) – colon separated path to data directories list, will be iterated upon during epochs in round-robin manner; however, valid and test data are always in the first directory to avoid the need for repeating them in all directories

  • source_lang (str) – source language

  • target_lang (str) – target language

  • load_alignments (bool) – load the binarized alignments

  • left_pad_source (bool) – pad the source on the left

  • left_pad_target (bool) – pad the target on the left

  • max_source_positions (int) – max number of tokens in the source sequence

  • max_target_positions (int) – max number of tokens in the target sequence

  • upsample_primary (int) – the amount of upsample primary dataset

  • truncate_source (bool) – truncate source to max-source-positions

  • num_batch_buckets (int) – if >0, then bucket source and target lengths into N buckets and pad accordingly; this is useful on TPUs to minimize the number of compilations

  • train_subset (str)

  • required_seq_len_multiple (int)

  • eval_bleu (bool) – evaluation with BLEU scores

  • eval_bleu_args (str) – generation args for BLUE scoring, e.g., '{"beam": 4, "lenpen": 0.6}', as JSON strin

  • eval_bleu_detok (str) – detokenize before computing BLEU (e.g., 'moses'); required if using --eval-bleu; use 'space' to disable detokenization; see fairseq.data.encoders for other options

  • eval_bleu_detok_args (str) – args for building the tokenizer, if needed, as JSON string

  • eval_tokenized_bleu (str) – compute tokenized BLEU instead of sacrebleu

  • eval_bleu_remove_bpe (str) – remove BPE before computing BLEU argparse_const: @@

  • eval_bleu_print_samples (str) – print sample generations during validation

tasks.srp_translation. SRPTranslationTask (FairseqTask ) 

Translate from one (source) language to another (target) language.

Functions:

  • __init__ – Initialize SRPTranslationTask

  • setup_task – Setup the task (e.g., load dictionaries)

  • load_dataset – Load a given dataset split

  • build_dataset_for_inference – Generate a batched dataset for the given source tokens

  • build_generator – Build a :class:`~fairseq.SequenceGenerator` instance for this task

  • build_model – Build a new model instance

  • train_step – Do forward and backward, and return the loss as computed by *criterion* for the given *model* and *sample*

  • valid_step – Do forward and return loss, sample size, and logging outputs

  • reduce_metrics – Aggregate logging outputs from data parallel training

  • max_positions – Return the max sentence length allowed by the task

  • source_dictionary – Return the source :class:`~fairseq.data.Dictionary`

  • target_dictionary – Return the target :class:`~fairseq.data.Dictionary`

  • _inference_with_bleu – Return the BLUE score
